head.title: Saxonica: XSLT and XQuery Processing: Highlights

meta.name: title
meta.content: Saxonica: XSLT and XQuery Processing: Highlights

body.p: This page lists some of the most important new features introduced in Saxon 9.1.
The following apply to Saxon-SA only:

li.p: Streaming extensions: more streaming capabilities in XSLT, and addition of streaming capabilities to XQuery.
XQuery Updates: Saxon now implements the (draft) XQuery Updates specification.

XML Schema 1.1 support: Saxon 9.1 implements many of the more significant features from the draft XML Schema 1.1 specifications, including Assertions, Conditional Type Assignment (co-occurrence constraints), and xs:all groups with flexible occurrence limits.

body.p: In Saxon-B, the most significant feature is probably support for the latest (almost-final) draft of the XQJ specifications (Java API for XQuery).
